edu.rit.io

Class ThreadedOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • edu.rit.io.ThreadedOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class ThreadedOutputStream
extends java.io.OutputStream
    Class ThreadedOutputStream provides an object that automatically synchronizes multiple threads writing to an underlying output stream. The bytes written to a ThreadedOutputStream by different threads go into separate internal buffers. When a thread calls the flush() method, only that thread's buffer is written to the underlying output stream.

    To get a multiple safe PrintStream, layer a new print stream with autoflushing turned off on top of a new threaded output stream on top of an underlying output stream. Multiple threads can then print multiple-line outputs on the new print stream. With autoflushing turned off, nothing will get written to the underlying output stream until a thread calls the new print stream's flush() method. This ensures that multiple-line outputs from different threads will not be commingled in the underlying output stream.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write(int b)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Write the given byte to this threaded output stream. The byte is stored in the calling thread's buffer and is not written to the underlying output stream until the flush() method is called.
        Specified by:
        write in class java.io.OutputStream
        Parameters:
        b - Byte. Only the least significant 8 bits of b are written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • write

        public void write(byte[] buf,
         int off,
         int len)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Write a portion of the given byte array to this threaded output stream. The bytes are stored in the calling thread's buffer and are not written to the underlying output stream until the flush() method is called.
        Overrides:
        write in class java.io.OutputStream
        Parameters:
        buf - Byte array to write.
        off - Index of first byte to write.
        len - Number of bytes to write.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if buf is null.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if off < 0, len < 0, or off+len > buf.length.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Flush the calling thread's buffer to the underlying output stream. The flush() method is synchronized, so that multiple threads calling flush() will not have their buffers' contents commingled.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface java.io.Flushable
        Overrides:
        flush in class java.io.OutputStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • flushAll

        public void flushAll()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Flush all the threads' buffers to the underlying output stream. The order in which the threads' buffers are flushed is not specified.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Close this threaded output stream. All the threads' buffers are flushed to the underlying output stream in an unspecified order; the underlying output stream is closed; and this threaded output stream is closed.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Overrides:
        close in class java.io.OutputStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.
